com.soen6441.core.map

Class GridMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soen6441.core.map.GridMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IArchive

    public class GridMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements IArchive

    Introduction

    GridMap is the core logic of the game.

    It represent the logical map in the game, and manage anything on the map.



    Tasks

    Tasks - Item Management

    Basic Concepts

    There is a 2D coordinate in the GridMap.

    MapPoint, consist of x and y, represent the point on the coordinate.

    width and height indicate the boundary of the coordinate.

    Anything on the map, will be considered as an Item.

    Any class representing a map item, should inherit class MapItem.

    Knowned subclasses of MapItem: Road, Tower.

    There will be only one on-grid MapItem at one location, where the x and y are integer.

    To set the boundary

    Use setWidth(int) and setHeight(int) to setup the map before using it

    Once the width or height are changed, every item on the map will be removed to build a map with the new size

    To add an item

    Call setItem(MapItem, MapPoint) to add an on-grid item at a specific location on the map.

    Call setItem(MapItem) if the location of the item has already set.

    Attention: you need to call getItem(MapPoint) before calling this method, to check if there is an existed item on the location.

    To check an item

    Call getItem(MapPoint) with a location to get an on-grid item.

    null means nothing on the location or the location is out of the boundary.

    To remove an item from the map

    Call removeItem(MapItem) with a location to remove an on-grid item.

    Other convince methods

    Call getAllItems() to get all on-grid items.



    Tasks - Selection

    Basic Concepts

    The GridMap actually do not support selection behaviour.

    However, it provide some method to record a location but not to manage the selection.

    To record a selected item

    To record a item as selected, you can only record the location.

    Call setSelectedPoint(MapPoint) to record where to be selected.

    To get a selected item

    Call getSelectedItem() to get the selected item.

    Or, call getSelectedPoint() to get only the selected location.



    Tasks - Path

    General Idea

    The GridMap actually has two group of information to describe the path on the map.

    Group 1: Many Road object, where the Road.getRoadType() will indicate the entry point or exit point.

    Group 2: paths, startPoints, endPoints, where is a abstract way to describe the path on the map.

    Group 1

    When user edit the map via the EditingScene, they only manipulate the Group 1.

    When validator check the map, they only check information in Group 1.

    Group 2

    When saving a map, only information in Group 2 will be saved.

    When reading a map file, the map will be recovered with only the information in Group 2.

    Bridge between Group 1 and Group 2

    So, before saving a map, someone needs to transform the information in Group 1 to Group 2.

    As well, after reading a map file, someone needs to transform the data in Group 2 to Group 1.

    To transform between Group 1 and Group 2

    There is a PathManager object in the gridMap to handle the transform.

    Call getPathManager() to get the path manager.

    Then, call PathManager#generatePathsFromRoadItems␀() to transform Group 1 to Group 2.

    Or, call PathManager#generateRoadItemsFromPaths␀() to transform Group 2 to Group 1.

    To validate the map

    PathManager object will also handle the path validation.

    Call getPathManager() to get the path manager.

    Then, call PathManager.validate() to validate the map.

    Attention: Group 1 information will be needed to execute the validation.

    To get start points or end points

    The type of the #endPoints are array, though, the app does not support multi-entry or exits now.

    Call getStartPoints() or getEndPoints() then get the first item in the list.

    To get a path starting from a point

    Call pathFrom(MapPoint).

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Zhe Zhao, Mohammad Ali

      • setItem

        public void setItem(MapItem item,
           MapPoint location)
        Set a grided map item on to the map. This method should be used only if the item will be place on grid. The connection between item and location will be setup in this method.
        Parameters:
        item - The item
        location - An grided location where put the item

      • getItem

        public MapItem getItem(MapPoint location)
        Get a grided map item on the map
        Parameters:
        location - An grided location you want to check
        Returns:
        Return the item if there is, or return null if there isn't, or return null if the location is out of the boundary.

      • pathFrom

        public java.util.List<MapPath> pathFrom(MapPoint point)
        Get any path which start from a specific point If there is no branches in the game, it will give you only one path
        Parameters:
        point - The location
        Returns:
        It will return all the paths which start from the point. If there is no path start from the point, it will return an list object but no object in it.
